definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Yes, Mike Tyson, a man who once chewed on human ear, is now vegan.
sentences.chinese: 是的，曾经咬人耳朵的拳手泰森现在是一个素食者了。

sentences.english: I've always believed that aggressive southpaws are able to put hands on Marquez.
sentences.chinese: 我一直认为咄咄逼人的左撇子拳手能够击中马奎兹。

sentences.english: That was the most anybody has ever landed on Pacquiao in a single round.
sentences.chinese: 这是大部分拳手在一个回合里打在帕奎奥身上的拳数。

sentences.english: No active fighter can come close to equaling De La Hoya's name recognition and earning power.
sentences.chinese: 没有一个现役拳手能够媲美霍亚的名声和票房。

sentences.english: "Female fist hand " become for a time " cruel " pronominal.
sentences.chinese: “女拳手”一度成为“酷”的代名词。

sentences.english: Yet, like all fighters, Pat  Glendon had  agreed to abide  by the  decision of the referee.
sentences.chinese: 但像其他所有拳手一样，他接受了裁判的判罚。

sentences.english: Is he the hardest puncher you've dealt with?
sentences.chinese: 他是你指导的出拳最狠的拳手吗？

sentences.english: De La Hoya has long been boxing's most popular fighter and biggest attraction.
sentences.chinese: 霍亚一直是最有号召力和最炙手可热的拳手。

sentences.english: I have never been the same after challenging a professional MMA fighter to a fight.
sentences.chinese: 在挑战了一位职业综合格斗拳手后，我完全变了。

sentences.english: A: Man, that guy was a really good boxer.
sentences.chinese: 天啊，那家伙真是个好拳手。

sentences.english: Man， that guy was a really good boxer.
sentences.chinese: 天啊，那家伙真是个好拳手。

sentences.english: Most American boxers aren’t fit to tie your boots.
sentences.chinese: 大多数美国拳手都不配给你系鞋带。

sentences.english: No heavyweight combined the two assets so formidably.
sentences.chinese: 从未有重量级拳手可以如此完美地将两者结合在一起。

sentences.english: I consider the 26-year-old pressure fighter to be a mature prospect.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这位26岁的施压型拳手将成长为希望之星。

sentences.english: The crowd jeered when the boxer was knocked down.
sentences.chinese: 当那个拳手被人打倒时，人群开始寒笑他。

sentences.english: The two boxers gazed at each other, wanting to stare down the opposite party.
sentences.chinese: 两名拳手互相瞪着眼睛，想以此震慑住对方。

definition: to fight, esp. with hands/wrestling (as a sport)/to wrestle/to wrestle (against fate, with a problem etc)/to capture prey
elevated stage on which martial competitions or duels were held/arena/ring
